events.21\tOctober\t1296: Alauddin Khalji conquered the throne of Delhi. In July declared himself as the Sultan.
events.21\tOctober\t1577: Guru Ramdas, Sikh Guru, established Amritsar city.
events.21\tOctober\t1762: Herman W Daendels, Brig-General and Governor General of Dutch-Indies (1807-11), was born.
events.21\tOctober\t1789: Ramshastri Prabhune, justice of Peshwa kingdom, died.
events.21\tOctober\t1858: Ramabai Dongre Medhavi, great social reformer, was born.
events.21\tOctober\t1887: Dr. Sri Krishna Sinha, great politician, revolutionist leader and chief minister, was born at Khanwa.
events.21\tOctober\t1906: Gandhiji went to England till Nov 30 on deputation to present Indians' case to Colonial Secretary.
events.21\tOctober\t1916: Dinkarrai Dhirajlal Desai, cricket Test Umpire for 3 tests from 1955-57, was born in Gujarat.
events.21\tOctober\t1934: Loknayak Jayprakash Narayan and his friends established the 'Congress Socialist Party' and Acharya Narendra Dev was its President and JP was its Gen. Secretary.
events.21\tOctober\t1943: Azad Hind Government was established in Singapore and Netaji Subhashchandra Bose was elected as its national leader.
events.21\tOctober\t1947: The office of Controller of Military Accounts (Pensions), Lahore was bifurcated and the pension work relating to Indian nationals was transferred to Allahabad.
events.21\tOctober\t1954: Government of India and France sign an agreement for the de-facto transfer of the French settlement of Pondicherry, Karaikal, Mahe to the Indian Union. The merger took place on November 1.
events.21\tOctober\t1959: Chinese and Indian troops clash on Ladakh border.
events.21\tOctober\t1989: Sukhdev Singh alias Sukha and Harminder Singh alias Jinda sentenced to death for the murder of former Army Chief Gen. A. K. Vaidya.
events.21\tOctober\t1990: Doordarshan starts afternoon news bulletins at 2 p.m. (Hindi) and 3 p.m. (English) of 7.5 minutes duration on week days and 5 minutes on Sundays.
events.21\tOctober\t1994: Government notifies substantial increase in the ceiling on election expenses on Lok Sabha and Assembly polls.
events.21\tOctober\t1995: Suresh Mehta, Finance Minister in the outgoing Keshubhai Patel ministry, sworn in as the second BJP CM of Gujarat in Gandhinagar, ending the month-long political turmoil.
events.21\tOctober\t1996: Japan gets non-permanent seat in Security Council after a contest with India.
events.21\tOctober\t1997: RBI de-regulates deposit rates, reduces CRR and Bank Rate (from 10\% to 9) and allows banks to have two sets of Prime Lending Rates.
events.21\tOctober\t1998: Ajit alias Hamid Ali Khan (76), Hindi film actor, dies in Hyderabad.
events.21\tOctober\t1999: Madhavrao Scindia becomes the Deputy Leader of Congress (I) in the Lok Sabha.
events.21\tOctober\t2000: Seema Antil becomes the first Indian ever to win a global title by bagging a gold medal in disc throw in the World Junior Athletic championship in Santiago.
